author: Erich Schwartzel
title: Oscar Nominee James Ivory on Avoiding ‘Visual Poison’
text:
Beverly Hills, Calif.—James Ivory is a man who maintains a certain aesthetic standard. 
Throughout his day, the writer and director avoids what he calls “visual poisoning,” which arises when “your eye cannot see or find harmonies” and is bombarded instead with images that are “awful, ugly, formless.” It’s even been known to knock him out.
